noun.description: An animal with many feet (now chiefly historical and poetic).

adjective.description: Of a machine or vehicle: having more than two legs.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Philemon Holland (1552–1637), translator. From classical Latin multipeda (also multiped-, multipēs) a small creature with many feet or legs from multi- + pēs foot, after ancient Greek πολύπους polypus.
